content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I believe that the test cases and the problem are very well written, it is solvable within 5 minutes without too much effort, and the idea seems unique. It still provides a decent challenge for the user to figure out how to approach the problem, which is a good thing.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: As I like to do that in real life (people must think I'm crazy), I totally approve the idea. 
The statement is clear enough and all types of clashes will be adapted.
Just add the missing word in the third paragraph: "Consonants ARE all the English..."

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: L'énoncé est clair et le challenge suffisant pour être stimulant.

"If there are no consonants at the start of one or both name(s), then just treat the part(s) being swapped as an empty string (e.g. Aaron Burr becomes Baaron Urr)"
* Please consider adding a second example such as Test 6 or Test 7 so that users can "see" what's happening with "Aaron Burr" more clearly.

I like the idea, though. Seems fun. :)

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Cases
* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the first name starts with a consonant and the last name starts with a vowel.

* Test 6 and Validator 6 are odd. If you do want to keep such cases, please split them and make a pair of test and validator for each of those cases.

Thanks.
Made this after playing a clash with user Frenjamin.Banklin and enjoying the subtle little swap operation involved. :)
Thanks. Implemented these, except for the last one I just took the advice on and added "y" as a vowel so that they are much less weird now since every name now has a vowel in it.
Just implemented your suggestion, using "Gary Oldman" as a second example in the statement.
Thanks for the typo correction and the approval! :)
